item.description:
Hello, fellow diners! Once again, your selection for our latest "letter" restaurant has SSDOMG heading south! For our "C" restaurant, you chose the countrified, yet elegant Crane Brook Restaurant & Tea Room in South Carver.

Located near the clear waters of Sampson's Pond on a site that featured a cannonball-producing iron foundry during the War of 1812, Crane Brook has been a well regarded restaurant for a long time. It is a place to come when you're in the mood for good food and unhurried conversation. Lunch offerings range from an 8 oz. Black Angus Hamburger ($8.95) to an Artisanal Salami & Ham Board ($14.95), and even include a Bouilliabase ($13.95).

Mike, who suggested this venue, is looking forward to sharing Crane Brook's food and atmosphere with his fellow SSDOMG members. Please join us as, like the hunting crane itself, we once again stalk a memorable culinary experience.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Crane Brook Restaurant & Tea Room.
229 Tremont St., South Carver
Saturday, April 26, 2008 @ 1:00 PM

Organizer: Mike

Min/Max: None at this time.

Guests: Yes. Up to two per member.

Event Fee: S2.00 per person.

RSVP Deadline: Thursday, April 24 @ 8:00 PM.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Directions (Credit to Crane Brook Website):

From Rte. 3 South (Coming from Braintree):

Head South on Route 3 to Exit 6B in Plymouth (Samoset Street/Carver). Take a right at the end of the ramp onto Route 44 West. At the 3rd set of traffic lights, take a left onto Seven Hills Road. At the Stop sign, take a right onto Federal Furnace Road. Follow for approximately 6.8 miles. The Crane Brook is located on the right side of the road.

Note: At the Plymouth/Carver town line, Federal Furnace becomes Tremont Street.

From Route 3 North (Coming from Cape Cod):

Head North on Route 3 to Exit 6 in Plymouth (Rte. 44 East and Samoset St). At the end of the exit, take a Left onto Samoset St. At the 3rd set of traffic lights, take a left onto Seven Hills Road. At the Stop sign, take a right onto Federal Furnace Road. Follow for approximately 6.8 miles. The Crane Brook is located on the right side of the road.

Note: At the Plymouth/Carver town line, Federal Furnace becomes Tremont Street.


From North Rte. 495 (Rte. 24 South to 495 South) From Boston, Quincy, Braintree, Avon:

Head South on Rte. 495 to Exit 2. Take a left off of the exit to Rte. 58 North. Follow for approximately 2.5 miles. Rte. 58 will turn left heading North towards Carver Center/Edaville Railroad - Do Not Take This Left. Continue Straight onto Tremont for 1/4 of mile and The Crane Brook is located on the left just around the turn in the road.

From South - Rte. 495 (Rte. 195 & 25 to 495 North) From Cape Cod/New Bedford Area:

Head North on Rte. 495 to Exit 2. Take a right off of the exit to Rte. 58 North. Follow for approximately 2.5 miles. Rte. 58 will turn left heading North towards Carver Center/Edaville Railroad - Do Not Take This Left. Continue Straight onto Tremont for 1/4 of mile and The Crane Brook is located on the left just around the turn in the road.
item.how_to_find_us: If you don't see any of your fellow Meetup members whan you arrive, please just ask to be shown to our table. The names "Mike" and "South Shore Meetup Group" have been noted on our reservation.

group.name: The South Shore Dining Out Meetup Group

item.name: "C" You at Cranebrook!
